title: SORRY BABY Thoughtfully Explores Trauma's Aftermath
description: SORRY BABY Thoughtfully Explores Trauma's Aftermath Read the full article on AICN Hey friends. Barbarella here after being enthralled with Sorry, Baby, a thoughtfully told story about the enduring effects of trauma. In theaters now, Eva Victor’s film proves both sensitive and candid. Although violence lies at the center of everything, it avoids showing any potentially triggering sequences. During the pivotal event that takes place within a house, the camera remains outside holding a static shot on the domicile’s façade. The viewer could only imagine what occurs behind the door. The stillness of the scene provides a stark contrast to the savagery we envision happening within. This masterful decision makes the scene more powerful as we must sit with the knowledge and gravity of what we suspect occurs inside. This quiet restraint characterizes much of the film, distinguishing it from other cinematic explorations of trauma. Much of the film proves artfully still as Agnes (Eva Victor) grapples with her life in the aftermath of the aforementioned event. While the topic is serious, it’s not an unrelenting, heavy film. Rather, it’s injected with humor and care throughout. The tale reveals the deep impact a moment in time could have on a life’s trajectory, and it shows the resilience of survivors as they struggle to find meaning, humor, and connection in the aftermath.   Sorry, Baby relies heavily on its brilliant cast who draw out the intricacies of each moment. Naomi Ackie and Eva Victor do most of the heavy lifting, carrying the emotional heart of the film, and I can’t get enough of either. Naomi imbues Lydie Finish the article on AICN
author: Barbarella

title: Krypto Currency!! Hercules Loves James Gunn’s SUPERMAN!!
description: Hercules loves Superman 2025 Read the full article on AICN Superman 2025 FAQ I am – Hercules!! What’s it called? “Superman.” Who’s responsible? James Gunn, writer and director of the wonderful “The Suicide Squad” (the one with Idris Elba and John Cena, not the one with Will Smith) and all three excellent “Guardians of the Galaxy” movies. Is it any good? Like much of Gunn’s prior work, it’s funny and moving and exciting, and never boring. There’s plenty to nitpick, but you’d be a fool to miss this very entertaining entertainment. What says Warner Bros.? “Superman embarks on a journey to reconcile his Kryptonian heritage with his human upbringing as Clark Kent.” How does it start? As John Williams’ Superman theme plays, a lot of text catches us up on what happened: 300 years ago superhumans became public knowledge on Earth, 30 years ago an alien spacecraft crashed into Kansas, 3 years ago a new superhuman arrived in Metropolis, 3 weeks ago a superhuman interfered in a middle-eastern conflict, 3 hours ago another new superhuman, one billing himself as The Hammer of Borovia, arrived in Metropolis, and 3 minutes ago Superman loses a brawl for the first time ever.* Then we see what a lot of fans have already seen in that famous clip: a bloodied and beaten Superman crash-lands in a field of snow, then summons Krypto to take him home. (*It is NOT mentioned in this exposition dump that Lois and Clark became romantically involved 3 months ago.) The Finish the article on AICN
author: hercules

The film adaptation of the Capcom videogame is set to star Austin Abrams, and in a new interview, Cregger revealed why he wanted to tell this story. “Because I love the games,” Cregger told ComicBook. “I played […]
author: Armando Tinoco

title: New 'Bad Hombre' Teaser for PTA's 'One Battle After Another' Movie
description: "We used to run around and do some real bad shit together... They got her - now they're coming for us!" Danger! Warner Bros unveiled two promo teasers for PTA's One Battle After Another - still scheduled to open in theaters nationwide in September. A few months to go... This riveting new action thriller is about a father trying to find his daughter (rewatch the first official trailer). There is still no synopsis but here's the one-liner: When their evil nemesis resurfaces after 16 years, a band of ex-revolutionaries reunite again to rescue the daughter of one of their own. This stars Leonardo DiCaprio as Bob Ferguson, plus Regina Hall, Sean Penn, Alana Haim, Teyana Taylor, Wood Harris, Benicio del Toro as "Sensei", with Shayna McHayle. This is also the sixth movie collaboration between P.T. Anderson and composer Jonny Greenwood. The movie isn't premiering at the Venice Film Festival, instead it's likely to just hit theaters in the fall without a festival stop first. Still looks like it's going to be a blast to watch! I'll be there opening day. Here's the "Bad Hombre" teaser for Paul Thomas Anderson's One Battle After Another, via YouTube: You can rewatch the first […]
author: Alex Billington

title: Hollywood Needs Your Help! 'Save Comedy' PSA for 'The Naked Gun'
description: "For the price of one movie ticket, and you can help rescue a comedy. And in the process, you'll get to share a smile, a laugh, and the occasional groan with the people in your very own community. Right now there's a comedy movie that needs you..." Ha ha. Paramount has debuted a funny fake (or is it?) PSA video for The Naked Gun movie, directed by the comedy mastermind Akiva Schaffer. The video features Liam Neeson trying to convince you to buy a ticket and help save comedies in Hollywood because less & less of them are being made nowadays. (It's true!) "A Naked Gun for the modern age — only in theatres August 1st." Watch the full trailer here. Liam Neeson stars in this as Lt. Frank Drebin Jr., son of the original Frank Drebin, played by comedy maestro Leslie Nielsen. Joining the case are Pamela Anderson, Paul Walter Hauser, CCH Pounder, Kevin Durand, Cody Rhodes, Liza Koshy, Eddie Yu, & Danny Huston. The three original Naked Gun movies are some of the funniest ever made – for real. This PSA video is both a joke and also actually serious – not many good comedies ever open in […]
author: Alex Billington
